definition[0]: to stop using something and put it down, especially so you can do something else
example[0]: Richard had laid aside his book to watch what was happening.
definition[1]: to stop behaving in a particular way, or stop having particular feelings, especially so you can achieve something
example[1]: On the day of the wedding, all arguments between the families were laid aside.
example[2]: As a doctor, you often need to lay aside your personal feelings.
definition[2]: to keep something, especially money, so you can use it in the future
example[3]: She’d laid aside a few pounds each week from her wages.
